Voralpen Express The Voralpen Express, which literally translates to „pre-Alpine Express“, commutes between St. Gallen and Lucerne. In comparison to the other train rides in this post, the Voralpen Express is the least touristy one. It doesn’t come with fancy panorama windows and there’s no friendly voice pointing out what viaduct you just crossed. But that doesn’t make it any less worth riding. 125 kilometres (78 miles) The Voralpen Express leaves St. Gallen and Lucerne every hour, all year round. You don't need a reservation for the Voralpen Express.
